verses.kjv: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,
verses.ct: Some scribes and Pharisees from Jerusalem approached Jesus and asked,

verses.kjv: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.
verses.ct: "Why do your disciples ignore the tradition of the elders? They don't wash their hands before eating."

verses.kjv: But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?
verses.ct: He replied, "And why do you ignore God's commandment for the sake of your tradition?

verses.kjv: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.
verses.ct: God said, 'Honor your father and mother,' and 'Anyone who curses their father or mother must be put to death.'

verses.kjv: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, It is a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;
verses.ct: But you say that if someone tells their father or mother, 'Whatever help you might have received from me has been given to God as an offering,'

verses.kjv: And honour not his father or his mother, he shall be free. Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.
verses.ct: then that person doesn't need to honor their father or mother. So you've canceled out God's commandment with your tradition.

verses.kjv: Ye hypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,
verses.ct: You hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you:

verses.kjv: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with their lips; but their heart is far from me.
verses.ct: 'These people come near to me with their words and honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far away from me.

verses.kjv: But in vain they do worship me, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.
verses.ct: Their worship of me is pointless, because they teach human rules as though they were God's teachings.'"

verses.kjv: And he called the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:
verses.ct: Then Jesus called the crowd over and said, "Listen and make sure you understand this:

verses.kjv: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.
verses.ct: What goes into a person's mouth doesn't make them unclean. It's what comes out of their mouth that makes them unclean."

verses.kjv: Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?
verses.ct: His disciples came to him and said, "Do you realize the Pharisees were offended when they heard what you said?"

verses.kjv: But he answered and said, Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.
verses.ct: He answered, "Every plant that my heavenly Father didn't plant will be pulled up by the roots.

verses.kjv: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.
verses.ct: Ignore them. They are blind guides leading blind people. When a blind person leads another blind person, both of them will fall into a pit."

verses.kjv: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.
verses.ct: Peter spoke up and said, "Explain this illustration to us."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said, Are ye also yet without understanding?
verses.ct: Jesus said, "Do you still not get it either?

verses.kjv: Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?
verses.ct: Don't you realize that whatever enters the mouth passes into the stomach and then gets expelled from the body?

verses.kjv: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.
verses.ct: But the things that come out of the mouth originate in the heart, and those are what make a person unclean.

verses.kjv: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:
verses.ct: From the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, lying, and slander.

verses.kjv: These are the things which defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.
verses.ct: These are what make a person unclean. Eating without washing your hands doesn't make anyone unclean."

verses.kjv: Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.ct: Jesus left that area and traveled to the region of Tyre and Sidon.

verses.kjv: And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, thou son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.
verses.ct: A Canaanite woman from that region came and cried out to him, "Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is suffering terribly from a demon."

verses.kjv: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.
verses.ct: But Jesus didn't respond to her at all. His disciples came and urged him, "Send her away — she keeps shouting after us."

verses.kjv: But he answered and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.ct: He replied, "I was sent only to the lost sheep of the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.
verses.ct: But the woman came and knelt before him, saying, "Lord, please help me!"

verses.kjv: But he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children’s bread, and to cast it to dogs.
verses.ct: He responded, "It isn't right to take the children's bread and toss it to the dogs."

verses.kjv: And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.
verses.ct: She said, "That's true, Lord. But even the dogs get to eat the crumbs that fall from their master's table."

verses.kjv: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great is thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.
verses.ct: Then Jesus told her, "Woman, your faith is remarkable! What you've asked for is granted." And from that very moment, her daughter was healed.

verses.kjv: And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.
verses.ct: Jesus moved on from there and went near the Sea of Galilee. He climbed a hillside and sat down.

verses.kjv: And great multitudes came unto him, having with them those that were lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus’ feet; and he healed them:
verses.ct: Huge crowds came to him, bringing people who were lame, blind, unable to speak, disabled, and many others with various conditions. They laid them at Jesus' feet, and he healed them.

verses.kjv: Insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.
verses.ct: The crowd was amazed when they saw people who couldn't speak now talking, the disabled made whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. They praised the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Then Jesus called his disciples unto him, and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint in the way.
verses.ct: Jesus called his disciples together and said, "My heart goes out to these people. They've been with me for 3 days now and have nothing left to eat. I don't want to send them away hungry — they might collapse on the journey home."

verses.kjv: And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?
verses.ct: His disciples asked, "Where could we possibly find enough bread out here in this remote place to feed such a large crowd?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.
verses.ct: Jesus asked them, "How many loaves do you have?" They answered, "7, plus a few small fish."

verses.kjv: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
verses.ct: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground.

verses.kjv: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake them, and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
verses.ct: Then he took the 7 loaves and the fish, gave thanks to God, broke them apart, and handed them to his disciples, who distributed them to the crowd.

verses.kjv: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets full.
verses.ct: Everyone ate until they were full, and when they collected the leftover pieces, they filled 7 baskets.

verses.kjv: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.
verses.ct: The number who ate was 4,000 men, not counting women and children.

verses.kjv: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.
verses.ct: After sending the crowd on their way, Jesus got into a boat and traveled to the region of Magdala.
